Class CardPile

java.lang.Object
CardPile
public class CardPile extends Object
a collection of 0, 1 or more cards, which might represent a complete deck of cards, the cards in a player's hand, a discard pile or a pool of cards.

  • Field Summary

    static int
    ACE_HIGH

    static int
    EQUAL_FACES
    EQUAL_FACES means that Ace = 1, Jack = 10, Queen = 10, and K = 10.

      public static final int ACE_LOW
      ACE_LOW means that the Ace = 1, Jack = 11, Queen = 12, and K = 13. Used when calling makeDeck() method.

      ACE_HIGH means that the Ace = 14, Jack = 11, Queen = 12, and K = 13. Used when calling makeDeck() method.
      See Also:

    • EQUAL_FACES

      public static final int EQUAL_FACES
      EQUAL_FACES means that Ace = 1, Jack = 10, Queen = 10, and K = 10. Used when calling makeDeck() method.

  • Method Details

    • makeDeck

      public static CardPile makeDeck​(int type)
      A special method for creating a traditional, shuffled stack of 52 cards. Since various games might have different "values" for the cards, there are three options you might use: ACE_LOW, ACE_HIGH, or EQUAL_FACES.
      For example: 
           CardStack deck = CardStack.makeDeck(CardStack.ACE_LOW);
      For ACE_LOW and EQUAL_FACES, the Ace is worth 1; for ACE_HIGH, the Ace is worth 14. For EQUAL_FACES, the J, Q, K are all worth 10.
      Parameters:
      type - - CardStack.ACE_LOW, CardStack.ACE_HIGH, or CardStack.EQUAL_FACES
      Returns:
      a CardStack of 52 cards, shuffled.

    • addCard

      public void addCard​(Card c)
      adds the current card to this stack, at the bottom.
      Parameters:
      c - - the card to add

    • shuffle

      public void shuffle()
      reorders all the cards in the deck randomly.

    • hasCard

      public boolean hasCard()
      returns whether this stack has any cards in it.
      Returns:
      true, if there is at least one card in this CardStack.

    • dealCard

      public Card dealCard()
      removes the card at the top of the stack and returns it. Returns null if the stack is empty.
      Returns:
      the next card, or null if there isn't one.

    • size

      public int size()
      gets the number of cards on this stack.
      Returns:
      number of cards

    • removeAllCards

      public void removeAllCards()
      eliminates all the cards on this stack, resetting it to an empty stack.

    • takeAllCardsFromPile

      public void takeAllCardsFromPile​(CardPile otherPile)
      removes all the cards on the given stack and adds them to this stack, in order.
      Parameters:
      otherPile - - another CardStack, whose cards this stack is taking.

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(Card cardToMatch)
      determines whether the card given is an exact match for amy card in this pile.
      Parameters:
      cardToMatch - - a Card to seek
      Returns:
      - whether a Card with the same face, value and suit is in this pile.
